intro: Coccoloba zuliana, commonly known as the Zulian beautyberry, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its striking red berries that appear in clusters, often attracting birds and other wildlife. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a velvety texture. Coccoloba zuliana thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
